issue.title: 0.17-rc

repository.name: skein
repository.description: Convert glTF extras to Bevy Components using reflection

issue.body:
Notable changes for skein users:

* `.register_type` is no longer required
* Some types like `bevy_light::NotShadowCaster` have been renamed
* 
<details><summary>Here's a full list of components diffed between 0.16 and 0.17</summary>

</details>



---

Outstanding issues:

* https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/issues/20992 shows an issue with a workflow that is demo'd in `replace_material`. Replacing a material in a component hook. This won't block a skein release since its upstream functionality.

issue.title: Make specialization cache cleanup respect material swaps

labels.name: A-Rendering
labels.description: Drawing game state to the screen

labels.name: S-Needs-Review
labels.description: Needs reviewer attention (from anyone!) to move forward

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
# Objective

Swapping material types can break specialization caches.

Fixes #20992.

## Solution

Make sure that type erased bookkeeping (i.e. `RenderMaterialInstances`) runs first so that we can know whether the material was actually removed or just swapped.

## Testing

Example in #20992. Tested also with 2d and didn't seem to be an issue there.

issue.title: `entity_specialization_ticks.get(visible_entity).unwrap()` panics in `specialize_material_meshes`

labels.name: A-Rendering
labels.description: Drawing game state to the screen

labels.name: P-Regression
labels.description: Functionality that used to work but no longer does. Add a test for this!

labels.name: S-Needs-Reproduction
labels.description: Needs an up-to-date or minimal reproduction

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
## Bevy version and features

`0.17.0-rc.0`

## Relevant system information

```ignore
AdapterInfo { name: "AMD Radeon RX 7900 XTX (RADV NAVI31)", vendor: 4098, device: 29772, device_type: DiscreteGpu, driver: "radv", driver_info: "Mesa 25.1.7", backend: Vulkan }
```

## What you did

I tried migrating `bevy_wind_waker_shader`. 
On https://github.com/janhohenheim/bevy_wind_waker_shader/tree/bevy-0.17.0-rc (note the branch), run `cargo run --example basic`

## What went wrong

```
thread 'Compute Task Pool (10)' (927593) panicked at /home/hhh/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-1949cf8c6b5b557f/bevy_pbr-0.17.0-rc.1/src/material.rs:957:79:
called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
Encountered a panic in system `bevy_pbr::material::specialize_material_meshes`!
```

## Additional information

The offending line is `let entity_tick = entity_specialization_ticks.get(visible_entity).unwrap();` in `specialize_material_meshes`

The crate works in 0.16
